Hey just a little fix to anyone that can’t figure it out, when you are trying to make it say “currently costs level points” instead of “currently costs coins” just simply do this.
Go to ShopAssistant.java and search
if (c.myShopId == 18) {
c.sendMessage(c.getItems().getItemName(removeId)+": currently costs " + getSpecialItemValue(removeId) + " Pk Points.");
return;
}
under “}” put this

if (c.myShopId == shop id) {
c.sendMessage(c.getItems().getItemName(removeId)+": currently costs " + getSpecialItemValue(removeId) + " Level Points.");
return;
}

thanks hope this helps people.

item.description:
@yodead wrote:

Adding a leveling point system

difficulty 2/10 (This tutorial may seem long, but its actually really easy. especially if you already know some of it.)
Tested on: Hybrid PvP

First open: Player.java

Search for:

Below that, add this:

Save that file.

Now open: PlayerAssistant.java

Search for:

now, you will see something like:

case 0: sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!", 6248); sendFrame126("Your attack level is now "+getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill])+".", 6249); c.sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level."); c.getPA().sendFrame126("Combat Level: "+c.getCombatLevel()+"", 3983); sendFrame164(6247); break;

Below the code “Case 0:” and above “sendFrame126” add:

ADD THIS TO ALL CASE’S ~ CASE 0: - CASE 22:

This will add a point each time a player levels any skill.

Save that file.

Now open: PlayerSave.java

search for:

characterfile.write("pk-points = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.pkPoints), 0, Integer.toString(p.pkPoints).length());

below that add this:

characterfile.write("lvl-Points = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.lvlPoints), 0, Integer.toString(p.lvlPoints).length());

In that same file (PlayerSave.java) now search for:

} else if (token.equals("pk-points")) { p.pkPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2)

below that add this:

} else if (token.equals("lvl-Points")) { p.lvlPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);

This is just to save the lvlPoints the players gain from leveling their skills.

OPTIONAL!

You can also add this to check your lvlPoints:

Open file: commands.java

Search for:

The whole command should look like this:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players")) { c.sendMessage("There are currently "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ " players online."); }

Below that last “}” add the following command:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("mylvlps")) { c.sendMessage("You currently have " + c.lvlPoints + " level points."); }

NOW ANOTHER TUTORIAL ON HOW TO ADD A SHOP FOR THE LVLPOINTS TO BE USED AT.
Difficulty 1/10

open ShopAssistant.java

Search for:

under that you should see, different types of shops, such as the pest control point store; Like this:

[code]if (c.myShopId == 18) {
if (c.pcPoints >= getSpecialItemValue(itemID)) {
if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0){
c.pcPoints -= getSpecialItemValue(itemID);
c.getItems().addItem(itemID,1);
c.getItems().resetItems(3823);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“You do not have enough PC points to buy this item.”);
}

		}[/code]

Under that last “}” add this:

[code]if (c.myShopId == YOUR SHOP ID) {
if (c.lvlPoints >= getSpecialItemValue(itemID)) {
if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0){
c.lvlPoints -= getSpecialItemValue(itemID);
c.getItems().addItem(itemID,1);
c.getItems().resetItems(3823);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“You do not have enough lvl points to buy this item.”);
}

		}[/code]

Be sure to edit the “(c.myShopId == YOUR SHOP ID)” to your actual shop id your wanting to use. I am just going to use shop ID: 7.

In the same file (ShopAssistant.java) search for:

The whole function should look like this:

if(c.myShopId == 29 || c.myShopId == 30 || c.myShopId == 31) { if (c.playerItemsN[Slot1] >= TotPrice2) { if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0) { buyDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); c.getItems().deleteItem(6529, c.getItems().getItemSlot(6529), TotPrice2); c.getItems().addItem(itemID, 1); Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[c.myShopId][fromSlot] -= 1; Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0; if ((fromSlot + 1) > Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[c.myShopId]) { Server.shopHandler.ShopItems[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough tokkul."); break; } }

Now under that last “}” add this:

else if(c.myShopId == YOUR SHOP ID) { if (c.lvlPoints >= TotPrice2) { if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0) { buyDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); c.lvlPoints -= TotPrice2; c.getItems().addItem(itemID, 1); Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[c.myShopId][fromSlot] -= 1; Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0; if ((fromSlot + 1) > Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[c.myShopId]) { Server.shopHandler.ShopItems[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough lvl Points."); break; } }
Be sure to edit the “(c.myShopId == YOUR SHOP ID)” again.

This will set up the shops to use the Lvlpoints instead of actual coins, and will allow you to buy items with your lvlpoints.

Now in the same file again, search for:

The whole function will look like this:

if (c.myShopId == 18) { handleOtherShop(itemID); return false; }

Add this below that function:

if (c.myShopId == YOUR SHOP ID) { handleOtherShop(itemID); return false; }
Be sure to edit the “(c.myShopId == YOUR SHOP ID)” again.

Now save this file.

In the file where all the CFG’s are located, open Shops.cfg

This is where you will be inserting the items that will be sold in the shop, and the amount that will be sold. You can edit this to your own standard.

Here if you need a little explaination: Shop = YOUR SHOP ID NAME OF YOUR STORE Keep it 2[tab]2 ITEM ID[tab]amount of that item.

Now for a little explaining. Lets do an example:

This is a case for an abyssal whip.

Now the:

This is to tell the shop how much that item will cost. In this example, when you go to the lvlpoint shop, an abyssal whip will cost 100 lvlPoints.

Once you have edited your shop, and inserted all the items, you need to set a price for them. With the item id’s that you have inserted into the shop, create a price that you like. and it should look just like the following example I gave:
